channel.title: coding on Bud
channel.description: Recent content in coding on Bud

item.title: Npm Error Fix Babel Core
item.description: Error # npm ERR! Found: @babel/core@7.12.3 npm ERR! node_modules/@babel/core npm ERR! @babel/core@"7.12.3" from the root project npm ERR! peer @babel/core@"^7.0.0" from @babel/helper-compilation-targets@7.13.16 npm ERR! node_modules/@babel/helper-compilation-targets npm ERR! @babel/helper-compilation-targets@"^7.13.0" from @babel/helper-define-polyfill-provider@0.2.0 npm ERR! node_modules/@babel/helper-define-polyfill-provider npm ERR! @babel/helper-define-polyfill-provider@"^0.2.0" from babel-plugin-polyfill-corejs2@0.2.0 npm ERR! node_modules/babel-plugin-polyfill-corejs2 npm ERR! babel-plugin-polyfill-corejs2@"^0.2.0" from @babel/preset-env@7.13.15 npm ERR! node_modules/@babel/preset-env npm ERR! 2 more (babel-plugin-polyfill-corejs3, babel-plugin-polyfill-regenerator) npm ERR! @babel/helper-compilation-targets@"^7.13.8" from @babel/plugin-proposal-object-rest-spread@7.13.8 npm ERR! node_modules/@babel/plugin-proposal-object-rest-spread npm ERR! @babel/plugin-proposal-object-rest-spread@"^7.13.8" from @babel/preset-env@7.13.15 npm ERR!

item.title: How to Use Find
item.description: Find is frequently used to looking for a path of a file. Especially When I just want to use the cmd only, as I wanna be used to the way of non-gui handling on PC. Yes, I wanna be a dev. At least wanna keep my Terminali handling skill get improved. Well, So Find is the mostly used cmd, which is really good to know how to use it well.

item.title: Simply publishing hugo blog onto git page
item.description: Problem # While trying to deploy on git repository within a simple command, hugo has occured an error before building its result. ERROR 2021/04/05 19:35:35 mkdir /docs: read-only file system Situation # added publishDir : /docs as far as git-pages requires the /docs folder to deploy. Automatically wished to my docs folder deployed through git push master master. However, hugo commands got a stuck with it. How did I solve # removed publishDir : /docs in config.

item.title: How to Fix Nil Error During Setting Sass Hugo
item.description: Error # index.html:6:46": execute of template failed: template: index.html:6:46: executing “index.html” at <resources.ToCSS>: error calling ToCSS: type not supported in Resource transformations It was a bit time wasting. but the asset folder must be created in root folder. Solution # then the following lines worked. {{ $sass := resources.Get "sass/main.scss" }} {{ $style := $sass | resources.ToCSS }} <link rel="stylesheet" href="{{ $style.Permalink }}"> Attention # There is another asset folder in resource/_gen.

item.title: How to Solve Killed Git Error in Homebrew Mac
item.description: Error occured during Git installation without xcode # $ git zsh: killed git What I have was only brew. Didn’t want to install xcode Check # $ brew config HOMEBREW_VERSION: >=2.5.0 (shallow or no git repository) ORIGIN: (none) HEAD: (none) Last commit: never Core tap ORIGIN: (none) Core tap HEAD: (none) Core tap last commit: never Core tap branch: (none) HOMEBREW_PREFIX: /opt/homebrew HOMEBREW_CASK_OPTS: [] HOMEBREW_MAKE_JOBS: 8 Homebrew Ruby: 2.

item.title: Learning Shell is like a playing game!
item.description: Well, Still there are some things that I should have to keep learning. C Language, and shell are the things. I didn’t start yet about C lang, but The shell. Shell scripts seem very useful more than any other language. # Javascript, Java, etc. They need for only specific environment. On Web, or on a program. But the shell, When you have any of O/S, as there is basically installed shell.

item.title: How to Set Repeat Key Speed in Terminal
item.description: How to # xset r rate 250 60 Conclusion # There is another way as sudo kbdrate -r 10.9 -d 250 but There seems a complaint that doens’t speed up much. But for me, xset r rate 250 60 does work :D

item.title: Decided on Learning C Language 2020
item.description: So I’ll get start to learn C language. # Even I didn’t start or make any installation with that in this Linux laptop, but I believe there would be many profit for myself. C language can be used in broad fields. # As it’s called as a middle ware language, that can cover even in Embeded environment. As I’m into permaculture, one day I’ll try to make the better enviroment construct by the installation of sensors in a place to optimize the growth of crops.

item.title: Fork app subtree was the solution to upload specific folder
item.description: Git was super difficult for me. # but it took the time to get used with, inevitably. The matter of fact is that I needed to upload public folder which is the projection for this hugo blog. When I just able to upload the publicfolder to the gh-pages only, during wrapping up all git changes, I was the only way to seperately manage the hugo blog well. the right way was subtree.
